result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J Scheibe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any Washington County Walmart Store.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly J Scheibe in court.  Attorney Joseph Reback in court for Kelly J Scheibe. Def has paid up-front restitution.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend charge to Misdemeanor Theft, 943.50(1m)(b)&(4)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters no contest plea to amended Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly J Scheibe in court.  Attorney Joseph Reback in court for Kelly J Scheibe. Agreement has been reached - def needs time to pay up-front restitution.
